de.payleven.inappsdk

Interface PaylevenInAppClient


  • public interface PaylevenInAppClient
    In order to start working with the Payleven API, a new instance of the PaylevenInAppClient is required.

    Payleven API methods require the following permissions: 

     <uses-permission android:name="android.permission.INTERNET" />
 <uses-permission android:name="android.permission.ACCESS_NETWORK_STATE" />

    Also the following services must be added: 

     <service android:name="de.payleven.inappsdk.PaylevenCommunicationService"
 android:exported="false"
 android:process=":payleven" />

 <service android:name="de.payleven.inappsdk.PaymentInstrumentService"
 android:exported="false"
 android:process=":payleven" />

    Once the permissions and services are added, you will be able to get the instance of PaylevenInAppClient through PaylevenFactory.registerWithAPIKey(android.content.Context, String) method. A user token will be retrieved in the AddPaymentInstrumentListener.onPaymentInstrumentAddedSuccessfully(String) callback of createUserTokenWithPaymentInstrument(String, PaymentInstrument, String, AddPaymentInstrumentListener). We recommend storing this user token as it is mandatory in the backend to backend communication when making a payment request. The user token is also used in other API calls such as getPaymentInstrumentsList(String, String, GetPaymentInstrumentsListener), setPaymentInstrumentsOrder(String, String, java.util.List, SetPaymentInstrumentsOrderListener) and others.

    • Method Detail

      • createUserTokenWithPaymentInstrument

        void createUserTokenWithPaymentInstrument(String email,
                                        PaymentInstrument paymentInstrument,
                                        String useCase,
                                        AddPaymentInstrumentListener listener)
        Creates a user token based on the email address provided and adds the payment instrument to the user token previously created, for the use case specified. If the use case is null, the default use case will be used.

        If the creation of the payment instrument is successful, the user token to which the payment instrument was associates is returned in the AddPaymentInstrumentListener. In case of error, the result of the task will be a Throwable object that defines the reason why the task failed.

        To make sure that the payment instrument was added, call getPaymentInstrumentsList(String, String, GetPaymentInstrumentsListener) method

        Parameters:
        email - email based on which the user token is created.
        paymentInstrument - PaymentInstrument that is associated to the user token
        useCase - use case that is associated to the payment instrument added. In case an empty or null string is provided the default use case will be used
        listener - reacts on the result of the operation

      • addPaymentInstrument

        void addPaymentInstrument(String userToken,
                        PaymentInstrument paymentInstrument,
                        String useCase,
                        AddPaymentInstrumentListener listener)
        Associates a payment instrument to a user token, for a use case. If the use case is null, the default use case will be used.

        If the creation of the payment instrument is successful, the user token to which the payment instrument was associates is returned. In case of error, the result of the task will be a Throwable object that defines the reason why the task failed.

        The results of the task is returned in the AddPaymentInstrumentListener

        To make sure that the payment instrument was added, call getPaymentInstrumentsList( String, String, GetPaymentInstrumentsListener)

        Parameters:
        userToken - the user token to which we associate a payment instrument. If the user token is null, the task will fail
        paymentInstrument - payment instrument to add
        useCase - use case for which the payment instrument is added. In case an empty or null string is provided the default use case will be used
        listener - reacts on the result of the operation

      • getPaymentInstrumentsList

        void getPaymentInstrumentsList(String userToken,
                             String useCase,
                             GetPaymentInstrumentsListener listener)
        Retrieves the list of payment instruments associated to a user token, for a specific use case. If the use case is null, the default use case will be used. In case the task fails, the reason of the failure is returned in a Throwable object. The results of the task is returned in the GetPaymentInstrumentsListener The payment instruments returned are sorted based on the order used when making a payment
        Parameters:
        userToken - user token for which we are getting the payment instruments. If the user token is null, the task will fail
        useCase - the use case for which we are requesting the payment instrument. In case an empty or null string is provided the default use case will be used
        listener - reacts on the result of the operation

      • setPaymentInstrumentsOrder

        void setPaymentInstrumentsOrder(String userToken,
                              String useCase,
                              List<PaymentInstrument> paymentInstruments,
                              SetPaymentInstrumentsOrderListener listener)
        Sets the order of payment instruments for a use case, for a user token. If the use case is null, the default use case will be used. The payment instruments mandatory value is PaymentInstrument.identifier The order of the payment instruments in the list will represent the order in which the payment instruments will be used when making a payment

        The result of this task will be the number of payment instruments that were modified. In case the task fails, the reason of the failure is returned in a Throwable object. The results of the task is returned in the SetPaymentInstrumentsOrderListener.

        Parameters:
        userToken - the user token for which we do the task. If the user token is null, the task will fail
        useCase - the use case for which we sort the payment instruments. In case an empty or null string is provided the default use case will be used
        paymentInstruments - the list of payment instruments sorted in the new order
        listener - reacts on the results of the operation

      • disablePaymentInstrument

        void disablePaymentInstrument(String userToken,
                            PaymentInstrument paymentInstrument,
                            DisablePaymentInstrumentListener listener)
        Disables a payment instrument of a specified user token. The payment instrument will be disabled from all use cases to which it belongs to, so it cannot be used when a payment is triggered, no matter the use case

        In case the task fails, the reason of the failure is returned in a Throwable object. The results of the task is returned in the DisablePaymentInstrumentListener.

        Parameters:
        userToken - the user token to which we associated the payment instrument. If the user token is null, the task will fail
        paymentInstrument - the payment instrument that needs to be disabled
        listener - reacts on the results of the task

      • removePaymentInstrumentFromUseCase

        void removePaymentInstrumentFromUseCase(String userToken,
                                      PaymentInstrument paymentInstrument,
                                      String useCase,
                                      RemovePaymentInstrumentFromUseCaseListener listener)
        Removes a payment instrument associated to a user token from a use case. If the use case is null the default use case will be considered. After removing a payment instrument from a use case, when a payment is triggered with the respective use case, the payment instrument cannot be used anymore *

        In case the task fails, the reason of the failure is returned in a Throwable object. The results of the task is returned in the RemovePaymentInstrumentFromUseCaseListener.

        Parameters:
        userToken - the user token to which we associated the payment instrument. if the user token is null, the task will fail
        paymentInstrument - the payment instrument that needs to be removed if the payment instrument is null, the task will fail
        useCase - the use case from where the payment instrument is removed. In case an empty or null string is provided the default use case will be used
        listener - reacts on the results of the task
